children.description: Question: Could you clarify if you are referring to **returnpointswon1stserve** or **returnpointswon2ndserve** for the statistics, as there are two types of return points statistics available?

children.observation: {"error": "", "response": "{'Season': '2012', 'Surface': 'clay', 'category': 'returnpointswon1stserve', 'data': [{'Text': 'Please specify a valid category return serve pressure! Thanks'}]}"}

children.description:
The category "returnpointswon1stserve" for 2012 clay surfaces returned an unexpected response. It seems an error occurred. 

Question: Do you want me to refine the category or process a different sort of return statistic? For example, do you mean "returngameswon"?

children.observation: {"error": "", "response": "{'Season': '2012', 'Surface': 'clay', 'category': 'returnpointswon2ndserve', 'data': [{'Text': 'Please specify a valid category return serve pressure! Thanks'}]}"}

children.description: Question: It seems the requested category "return serve pressure" might not be correctly specified or valid. Could you clarify if you're requesting statistics specifically for "return points won on 2nd serve" or would you like broader return metrics (e.g., winning points on first serve returns, second serve returns, etc.)?

function.name: official_atp_players_rankings_for_ultimate_tennis
function.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "ultimate_tennis", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "This endpoint allows you to retrieve the rankings(**singles**+ **doubles**) of the current tennis season. You can arbitrarily decide the number of players displayed (nplayers) and the time window to refer to (timestamp).

For example, if nplayers = 10,  ca"

timestamp.description:
Time window

**IMPORTANT**: The timestamp must be in the following format **YYYY-MM-DD** and the date **must fall on Monday** since the rankings are updated at the start of every week

function.name: live_players_rankings_for_ultimate_tennis
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "ultimate_tennis", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "With this endpoint, you can retrieve info about the live tennis rankings for a given number of players, with position/points/info about the last match played in the current active tournament. Please note that in the ATP circuit the official leaderboard is "

n_player.description: Max: 500.  Please provide just an Integer

function.name: atp_player_stats_by_id_for_ultimate_tennis
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "ultimate_tennis", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Via this endpoint you can retrieve official updated statistics for a given ATPplayer. Values are updated after every played match. ID can be retrieved from the Official ATP Players Rankings endpoint."

surface.description: Valid options are: clay, grass, hard, all.

player_id.description: ID can be retrieved from the Official ATP Players Rankings endpoint.

function.name: player_info_by_id_for_ultimate_tennis
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "ultimate_tennis", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "This endpoint provides YTD and Career details for a selected player. You can obtain the Player ID from the WTA Rankings endpoint."

function.name: global_players_statistics_for_ultimate_tennis
function.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "ultimate_tennis", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "This endpoint allows you to retrieve global statistics about tennis players. You can customize the statistic (aces, breakpoints converted, 1st serve points won...), the season (all, 2022, 2021...), or the surface(clay, hard, grass).
You can find the list o"

season.description:
Select season to select. Just pass the year:
all- all time rankings

The first year supported is 1991.

surface.description: **clay**, **grass**or **hard**. Otherwise, just leave **all**to select all surfaces.

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"
